rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C90000

definition: Non-clinical terminology relevant to the degree of an occurrence of a reported finding.
name: SEND Severity

terms.definition: The first level of severity in an ordered list based on a three-level scale of 1, 2, and 3, with 1 being the lowest.
The first level of severity in an ordered list based on a four-level scale of 1, 2, 3, and 4, with 1 being the lowest.
The first level of severity in an ordered list based on a five-level scale of 1, 2, 3, 4, and 5, with 1 being the lowest.
The second level of severity in an ordered list based on a three-level scale of 1, 2, and 3, with 1 being the lowest.
The second level of severity in an ordered list based on a four-level scale of 1, 2, 3, and 4, with 1 being the lowest.
The second level of severity in an ordered list based on a five-level scale of 1, 2, 3, 4, and 5, with 1 being the lowest.
The third level of severity in an ordered list based on a three-level scale of 1, 2, and 3, with 1 being the lowest.
The third level of severity in an ordered list based on a four-level scale of 1, 2, 3, and 4, with 1 being the lowest.
The third level of severity in an ordered list based on a five-level scale of 1, 2, 3, 4, and 5, with 1 being the lowest.
The fourth level of severity in an ordered list based on a four-level scale of 1, 2, 3, and 4, with 1 being the lowest.
The fourth level of severity in an ordered list based on a five-level scale of 1, 2, 3, 4, and 5, with 1 being the lowest.
The fifth level of severity in an ordered list based on a five-level scale of 1, 2, 3, 4, and 5, with 1 being the lowest.
